title: Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation
text: McMahon J (2022). octopusR: Package interacting Octopus Energy API. https://github.com/Moohan/octopusR, https://moohan.github.io/octopusR/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {octopusR: Package for interacting with the Octopus Energy API},   author = {James McMahon},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/Moohan/octopusR, https://moohan.github.io/octopusR/}, }

what: Package for interacting with the Octopus Energy API
title: Package for interacting with the Octopus Energy API
text: octopusR R package provides access Octopus Energy API. octopusR, can easily retrieve data Octopus Energy API use R projects.

title: Package for interacting with the Octopus Energy API
text: octopusR yet available CRAN, must installed GitHub, install, can use devtools package:
code: # Install devtools if needed if (!require("devtools")) install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("moohan/octopusR")

title: Package for interacting with the Octopus Energy API
text: use function octopusR, need API key Octopus Energy, can find developer dashboard. API key, can use set_api_key() function interactively input store API key session: authenticated API, may also want set meter-point details. can use functions package interact API. example, can use get_consumption() function retrieve data energy usage: information examples, see package documentation Octopus Energy API documentation.
code: library(octopusR)  # Set your API key set_api_key() # Set details for your electricity meter set_meter_details(meter_type = "electricity")  # Set details for your gas meter set_meter_details(meter_type = "gas") # Get data about your energy usage energy_usage <- get_consumption(meter_type = "electricity")  # View the data head(energy_usage)

title: Package for interacting with the Octopus Energy API
text: suggestions improving octopusR, found bug, please open issue GitHub. Contributions form pull requests also welcome.

title: Package for interacting with the Octopus Energy API
text: octopusR licensed MIT License. See LICENSE information.

what: List consumption for a meter — get_consumption
title: List consumption for a meter — get_consumption
text: Return list consumption values half-hour periods given meter-point meter. Unit measurement: Electricity meters: kWh SMETS1 Secure gas meters: kWh SMETS2 gas meters: m^3

title: List consumption for a meter — get_consumption
code: get_consumption(   meter_type = c("electricity", "gas"),   mpan_mprn = get_meter_details(meter_type)[["mpan_mprn"]],   serial_number = get_meter_details(meter_type)[["serial_number"]],   api_key = get_api_key(),   period_from = NULL,   period_to = NULL,   order_by = c("-period", "period"),   group_by = c("hour", "day", "week", "month", "quarter") )

title: List consumption for a meter — get_consumption
text: meter_type Type meter-point, electricity gas mpan_mprn electricity meter-point's MPAN gas meter-point’s MPRN. serial_number meter's serial number. api_key API key. Octopus Energy customer, can generate API key online dashboard. period_from Show consumption given datetime (inclusive). parameter can provided . period_to Show consumption given datetime (exclusive). parameter also requires providing period_from parameter create range. order_by Ordering results returned. Default results returned reverse order latest available figure. Valid values: period, give results ordered forward. -period, (default), give results ordered recent backwards. group_by Aggregates consumption specified time period. day considered start end midnight server's timezone. default consumption returned half-hour periods. Accepted values : hour day week month quarter

title: List consumption for a meter — get_consumption

what: Return a list of energy products — get_products
title: Return a list of energy products — get_products
text: default, results public energy products authenticated organisations also see products available organisation.

title: Return a list of energy products — get_products
code: get_products(   is_variable = NULL,   is_green = NULL,   is_tracker = NULL,   is_prepay = NULL,   is_business = FALSE,   available_at = Sys.Date(),   authenticate = FALSE,   api_key = NULL )

title: Return a list of energy products — get_products
text: is_variable (boolean, optional) Show variable products. is_green (boolean, optional) Show green products. is_tracker (boolean, optional) Show tracker products. is_prepay (boolean, optional) Show pre-pay products. is_business (boolean, default: FALSE) Show business products. available_at Show products available new agreements given datetime. Defaults current datetime, effectively showing products currently available. authenticate (boolean, default: FALSE) Use api_key authenticate. useful organisations. api_key API key. Octopus Energy customer, can generate API key online dashboard.

title: Return a list of energy products — get_products
Return a list of energy products — get_products

Set the Octopus API key — set_api_key

what: Set the details for your gas/electricity meter — set_meter_details
title: Set the details for your gas/electricity meter — set_meter_details
text: can find meter details octopus energy developer dashboard

title: Set the details for your gas/electricity meter — set_meter_details
code: set_meter_details(   meter_type = c("electricity", "gas"),   mpan_mprn = NULL,   serial_number = NULL )

title: Set the details for your gas/electricity meter — set_meter_details
text: meter_type Type meter-point, electricity gas mpan_mprn electricity meter-point's MPAN gas meter-point’s MPRN. serial_number meter's serial number.
